content:
TOPIC: Antitrust and Zero Price markets..

From what I know, antitrust has to do with prevention from a monopoly taking place because it is inherently bad for consumers (at least that is what I remember from AP Econ) since they can raise price arbitrarily. However, it does make sense that often the effects of having one entity control an entire market depends on price. After all, market price generally depends on supply and demand (at least I think so). From what I can tell, this means that in terms of markets where services are often offered for free, this rhetoric of protecting the consumer may not have as much of a basis compared to a normal price based market. I could see how having just one
